itemContext.sbar: S: John Doe, a 22-year-old male Marine, presented to the ER at 03:00. He was found by a barracks mate crying and expressing feelings of hopelessness and worthlessness. B: Patient reports a recent breakup with his girlfriend of 2 years yesterday and not receiving a promotion he anticipated. He has no known psychiatric history but reports increased stress over the past month. A: Patient is visibly distressed, tearful, and reports 'not wanting to be here anymore.' Vital signs are within normal limits (HR 88, BP 120/80, RR 18, SpO2 99% on room air). Denies current suicidal plan but admits to passive suicidal ideation. R: I recommend immediate psychiatric evaluation and initiation of suicide precautions. He may benefit from short-term anxiolytic medication.

tabs.title: MAR
tabs.content: PRN Lorazepam 1mg PO q4h PRN anxiety - Available

topicTags: Mental Health: Suicide Risk & Crisis Management

rationale.correct: Assessing for suicidal ideation and plan is the FIRST priority to determine the immediate risk of self-harm. Initiating suicide precautions is SECOND, ensuring patient safety by removing potentially harmful objects and constant observation. Contacting the on-call psychiatrist is THIRD to obtain a formal mental health evaluation and treatment plan. Administering prescribed PRN lorazepam is FOURTH to manage acute anxiety symptoms *after* assessing suicide risk and ensuring safety. Encouraging verbalization of feelings is LAST because while supportive, it is not the immediate priority when assessing suicide risk.
rationale.incorrect: Incorrect prioritization could lead to patient harm. Delaying suicide risk assessment or failing to initiate appropriate safety measures can have devastating consequences. Failing to contact the psychiatrist delays comprehensive evaluation and treatment. Prioritizing comfort measures (lorazepam, verbalization) before assessing and ensuring safety is a dangerous error.
clinicalPearls: Always prioritize safety when assessing a patient with suicidal ideation.
A thorough suicide risk assessment includes assessing for ideation, plan, intent, and access to means.
Collaboration with mental health professionals is crucial in managing patients at risk for suicide.

questionTrap.trap: The availability of PRN lorazepam might tempt you to prioritize immediate anxiety reduction. While anxiety management is important, it is secondary to assessing and ensuring safety related to suicide risk.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: Remember ABCs in Mental Health: Assess (Suicide Risk), Safety (Suicide Precautions), Collaboration (Psychiatrist). Address the immediate risk before comfort measures.
